iam.description: This is the iam key where all iam permissions are attached for the deployment

^[a-zA-Z0-9_.-]*$.description: This is the name of the iam object that you are creating, it can be of any name

arn.definition: The arn of the policy that you want to create a role and attach it to the deployment

vm.description: This is the advanced block where we define vm implementation for aws

is_vm_image.description: Boolean value to specify if the artifact is vm ami or not

is_public.description: specify if the vm is public

security_group.description: Define securrity groups for the vm

additional_ingress_with_cidr_blocks.description: List of ingress rules to create where 'cidr_blocks' is used

^[a-zA-Z0-9_.-]*$.description: Define a name for the security group that you want to create

from_port.description: Define the port that you want to allow traffic from

to_port.description: Define the port that you want to allow traffic to

protocol.description: Define the protocol that you want the traffic to follow

cidr_blocks.description: Define the cidr range that you want to allow the traffic from

additional_ingress_cidr_blocks.description: List of IPv4 CIDR ranges to use on all ingress rules

^[a-zA-Z0-9_.-]*$.description: Define the IPv4 CIDR ranges to use on all ingress rules

tags.description: Tags you want to add to the security group

Name.description: A mapping of tags to assign to security group

enabled.description: Controls if the Load Balancer should be created

internal.description: Boolean determining if the load balancer is internal or externally facing

additional_http_tcp_listeners.description: Additional http tcp listeners that you want to add to the loadbalancer

^[a-zA-Z0-9_.-]*$.description: Define an arbitary name for the listener
Arbitary name for the default action
Arbitary name for the redirect options
Arbitary name for the fixed response

tags.description: Tags you want to add to the additional target groups

Name.description: A mapping of tags to assign to additional target groups

^[a-zA-Z0-9_.-]*$.description: A list of subnets to associate with the load balancer. e.g. ['subnet-1a2b3c4d','subnet-1a2b3c4e','subnet-1a2b3c4f']

additional_target_groups.description: A list of maps containing key/value pairs that define the target groups to be created. Order of these maps is important and the index of these are to be referenced in listener definitions. Required key/values: name, backend_protocol, backend_port

^[a-zA-Z0-9_.-]*$.description: Arbitary name for the additional target groups

lambda_multi_value_headers_enabled.description: specify lambda multi value headers enabled

^[a-zA-Z0-9_.-]*$.description: Arbitary name for health check
Arbitary name for stickiness

tags.description: Tags you want to add to the additional target groups

Name.description: A mapping of tags to assign to additional target groups

^[a-zA-Z0-9_.-]*$.description: Arbitary name for the target group arn's

tags.description: Tags you want to add to the security group

Name.description: A map of tags to add to all resources

autoscaling_group.description: Define autoscaling group for the vm's

use_mixed_instances_policy.description: Specify if you want to use use mixed instances policy

mixed_instances_policy.description: Configuration block containing settings to define launch targets for Auto Scaling groups

^[a-zA-Z0-9_.-]*$.description: Arbitary name for the mixed instances policy

instances_distribution.description: specify the details of instances distribution

^[a-zA-Z0-9_.-]*$.description: arbitary name for the instance distribution

on_demand_base_capacity.description: specify the on demand base capacity

on_demand_percentage_above_base_capacity.description: specify on demand percentage above base capacity

overrides.description: Specify your overrides for the instances

^[a-zA-Z0-9_.-]*$.description: arbitary name for the overrides that you want to make

weighted_capacity.description: Specify the weighted capacity that you want for the instance type

^[a-zA-Z0-9_.-]*$.description: Arbitary name for the launch template specification
Arbitary name for the placement of the instance

instance_refresh.description: If this block is configured, start an Instance Refresh when this Auto Scaling Group is updated

^[a-zA-Z0-9_.-]*$.description: Arbitary name for the instance refresh properties
arbitary name for the preferences

network_interfaces.description: Customize network interfaces to be attached at instance boot time

^[a-zA-Z0-9_.-]*$.description: Arbitary name for network interfaces

metadata_options.description: Customize the metadata options for the instance

^[a-zA-Z0-9_.-]*$.description: Arbitary name for metadata options

http_put_response_hop_limit.description: specify http put response hop limit

instance_market_options.description: The market (purchasing) option for the instance

^[a-zA-Z0-9_.-]*$.description: Arbitary name for the instance market options
Arbitary name for instance spot options

scaling_policies.description: Map of target scaling policy schedule to create

^[a-zA-Z0-9_.-]*$.description: Arbitary name for the scaling policies
Arbitary name for the step adjustment

metric_interval_lower_bound.description: specify the metric interval lower bound

metric_interval_upper_bound.description: specify the metric interval upper bound

^[a-zA-Z0-9_.-]*$.description: Arbitary name for the target tracking configuration
Arbitary name for the predefined metric specification
Arbitary name for customized metric specification
Arbitary name for predictive scaling configuration
Arbitary name for the metric specification
Arbitary name for the predefined load metric specification
Arbitary name for the predefined metric pair specification
Arbitary name for the predefined scaling metric specification

cpu_options.description: The CPU options for the instance

^[a-zA-Z0-9_.-]*$.description: Arbitary name for the cpu options

credit_specification.description: Customize the credit specification of the instance

^[a-zA-Z0-9_.-]*$.description: Arbitary name for credit specification

schedules.description: Map of autoscaling group schedule to create

^[a-zA-Z0-9_.-]*$.description: Arbitary name for the schedules

block_device_mappings.description: Specify volumes to attach to the instance besides the volumes specified by the AMI

^[a-zA-Z0-9_.-]*$.description: Arbitary name for block device mappings
Arbitary name for ebs
